head.citation-title: Vision Based Relative State and Inertia Knowledge Estimation of Un-cooperative Targets
head.abstracts: Â© 2023, The Author(s), under exclusive license to Springer Nature Singapore Pte Ltd.This paper proposes an algorithm to estimate the relative state and inertia knowledge based on the geometrical frame measurement. The relative pose of the geometrical frame relative to its body frame is introduced as a component of the state. The inertial ratios are parameterized as independent random variables without constraints by using the inverse hyperbolic tangent function. Using the measurements of the quaternion and translational vector of the geometrical frame, with the novel inertia parameter method, the relative state, inertial parameters, and pose of the geometrical frame are estimated by a designed extended Kalman filter. Numerical simulation results demonstrate the validity of the proposed algorithm.
